title: Graph of deriv.: 4 segments part - d

content.question: Find the average rate of change of g'(x) on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7. Does the Mean Value Theorem applied on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7 guarantee a value of c, for -3 < c < 7, such that g''(c) is equal to this average rate of change? Why or why not?

frqParts.text: Find the average rate of change of g'(x) on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7. Does the Mean Value Theorem applied on the interval −3 ≤ x ≤ 7 guarantee a value of c, for -3 < c < 7, such that g''(c) is equal to this average rate of change? Why or why not?

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
